ACCOUNTANT I

SUMMARY

A business management graduate with significant experience in disability services, human resources and finance department; seeking to apply my abilities to position in a human resource department.
Proven ability to deal with multiple tasks efficiently and maintain organization.
Highlights
Extensive customer service skills Able to retain the confidentiality of paperwork and information Flexible team player and quick learner, interested in new technologies Able to meet deadlines and handle stressful situations in a professional manner Microsoft Office: Word, Excel, Access and Outlook Knowledge of State accounting system[MMARS system], People Soft, System 7 and client tracking system Excellent Communicator: Written and Verbal Office Experience- Ability to create reports, analyze data and manipulate data

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Created a Pivot table for contracts department to utilize for renewal of contracts.
Received an opportunity to grow as an employee after my internship.
Work History

EXPERIENCE

Accountant I

12/2010 to Current

Provide Administrative support to the Finance Unit and maintain orderly filing system for various departmental units Oversee and maintain the proper and appropriate systems for storing financial records and documents utilized by finance unit Assist Contracts and Accounts Payable department with clerical duties such as faxing, filing, copying and scanning and assisting with the creation and editing of documents, spreadsheets or PowerPoint presentations.
Process travel reimbursements, incoming payment vouchers and financial documents in a timely and efficient manner Assist with payroll projections made for pay periods and end of the fiscal year Analyze financial reports for trends in major programs and to determine their effects on spending, and prepare financial projections accordingly Monitor internal budget for compliance with MMARS system Create quarterly report for agency Chief Financial Officer on time usage Prepare purchase orders and payment vouchers for processing Compile reports for the Senior Financial Analyst in an accurate manner Maintain organized and categorized Excel spreadsheet for auditing purposes Provide support for contracts department with entering data to internal database, mail merging of contract information, create MMARS contracts signoff sheets, and update contract's new fiscal year information.
Confer with agency personnel and outside agencies via e-mail or telephone to resolve finance discrepancies in a timely manner.

Organized and prepared marketing materials for various conferences, meetings and events Translated information into Spanish for staff and clients related to various projects Coordinate and prepare marketing materials for various conferences, meetings and events Provided safe transportation services to MCB staff to various consumer appointments.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Staff Accountant

Location: Columbia, MD

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Embark on a mission with Advanced Programs, Inc., (API) – where innovation meets impact! Join us as we revolutionize national security, responding swiftly to customer needs, and forging ahead with cutting-edge solutions. At API, we don't just meet expectations; we exceed them, creating a legacy of success in the ever-evolving landscape of intelligence, defense, and foreign affairs. This is your chance to be part of something extraordinary!We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Staff Accountant to join our team! This person will work on-site with the possibility for a hybrid schedule in the future.
Responsibilities:Maintain a computerized financial reporting system and compile financial data.Process invoices in a timely manner and investigate non-payments or invoice problems.Determine customer credit status and follow up with customers for collection.Perform bank deposits, apply cash into A/R system, and reconcile A/R balance to General Ledger.Participate in posting, balancing, analysis, and reconciliation of the general ledger and subsidiary accounts.Assist in preparation of forecasts and annual budgets.Compile financial data for income tax requirements.Assist outside auditors at year-end by preparing schedules and providing necessary data.Manage aging Accounts Receivable (A/R) reports to ensure timely collection of outstanding invoices.Utilize Department of State web portals proficiently for invoice submission and processing.Communicate effectively with Department of State representatives to resolve any issues or discrepancies related to invoice submissions.Provide exceptional customer service to internal and external stakeholders regarding billing inquiries and concerns.Build and maintain positive relationships with clients and vendors through effective communication and problem-solving.
Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance strongly preferred.2+ years of related experience preferred.Experience with NetSuite strongly preferred.Working knowledge of accounting principles and practices.Strong organizational skills.Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Proficiency in MS Office Suite, particularly Excel.Ability to work independently and as part of a team.U.S. Citizenship is required for all roles.
Physical Demands:While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, use hands, reach with hands and arms, and talk or hear.Occasionally required to stand, walk, and lift/move up to 10 pounds.

Job Type: Full-timePay: From $55,000.00 per year

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
